column4: that sounds like bug 877440 see comment #11 for a workaround that works for me
did you try the workaround in the comment in the bug I posted above? (device pair/unpair). Also seems to be fixed in 12.04
that is gnome 3 fallback mode, not gnome 2
Huh?
it is the gnome panel ported to gnome 3
well gtk3 that is
one last time, this is a bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/libplist/+bug/877440 it is fixed in precise but not oneiric
there is also a workaround listed in that bug by installing libimobiledevice-utils and using idevicepair unpair && idevicepair pair;
Like I said ealier
there is only one package, libimobiledevice-utils, it is in universe
but I need idevicepair and unpair
those are in libimobiledevice-utils
those are the commands you run in a terminal after installing
I ran the commands but still unable to mount the device.
after the pair/unpair you should be able to click the device in nautilus and it will mount (it worked for me anyway)
wait...
otherwise you may need to wait for the fixed version in 12.04 when it comes out later this month
unpair then pair, sorry
yes you are right, I typed it in the wrong order
wont mount.
I was when I had the problem I am not now, some later comments suggest unplugging and replugging after the unpair/pair
